title: Simulation Training for Enhancing Wine Science and Viticulture Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational winemaking and viticulture science knowledge
context.additional_context: VR environment enabling simulations of actual vineyards and wineries, with personalized device-linked learning via BYOD.

learning_goals: Students achieve at least 80% proficiency in grape cultivation environment analysis and quality management skills through VR simulations

Learners demonstrate and meet at least four of the five evaluation rubric criteria in a 4-week team-based winemaking project, including role allocation and collaboration (teamwork), a three-step approach to resolving quality control issues (problem-solving), and providing feedback to enhance team members' capabilities (leadership).

Learners design two creative solutions reflecting real-world industry requirements (e.g., productivity improvement, workforce management optimization), and submit a portfolio (including problem definitions, solutions, and expected outcomes) to achieve an "Excellent" or higher rating in at least four of the five evaluation rubric criteria.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
